content.description: Start on Buttress just below notch in spires, A fixed nut was at the base when we did the route (March '08).  Climb up buttress on low angle for 130' until a small ledge with belay potential is reached.  P2 Head right of belay on short steep section with good holds then run out on easy ground with few protection opportunities.   Belay on ledge with tree, backing up tree is highly advised.  P3 continue up to top of route, staying on the right half of buttress, fun moves with great exposure. Descend by walking off the back, head north and skirt the base of the rock to reach your packs.
content.protection: Standard rack, no fixed anchors on route, second set of nuts is good if your partner has butterfingers.

content.description:
Abundance of routes in secluded area of the Catalinas.  The long approach makes this area best for spring and fall climbing.  The quality of rock varies, so watch out for     "portable holds"  

  Esperero Spires proper is shady in the mornings with afternoon sun.  More information and route overhead can be found here: climbaz.com/Backcountry/pagâ€¦
